text: Hōei Nojiri. was a Japanese essayist and astronomer. He was a brother of the novelist Nojiri Haruhikoˀ, whose pen name was Osaragi Jirō. In 1930 he coined the Japanese word for the then-newly-discovered dwarf planet Pluto. The name was then borrowed into Chinese and Korean. == See also == * Osaragi Jirō [information on family] * 3008 Nojiri (main-belt asteroid) == References == Category:1885 births Category:1977 deaths Category:Japanese astronomers Category:Japanese writers Category:People from Yokohama
